meanings.sent1: Before the trip, I will preprogram the GPS with all the locations we plan to visit.
meanings.sent2: She is preprograming the robot to perform specific tasks at certain times.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to preprogram the oven to start baking the cake while he was out shopping.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to preprogram every step of the dance routine, moving effortlessly across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The students were amazed by how the computer could preprogram a series of commands to execute automatically.

meanings.definition: The act of programming in advance.
meanings.sent1: Preprograming allows us to set up tasks to be completed without manual intervention.
meanings.sent2: The preprograming of the security system ensured that the building was always protected.
meanings.sent3: The preprograming of the sprinkler system saved the garden from drying out during the hot summer.
meanings.sent4: Her detailed preprograming of the schedule made sure that everything ran smoothly during the event.
meanings.sent5: The success of the mission was attributed to the careful preprograming of each stage of the operation.
